• Additional connection attempt:
 – Recent execution steps targeted the newly placed Boiler at (x=-10.0, y=22.5) for linking with the Offshore Pump.
  ∙ Several candidate positions were computed (e.g. near offset positions such as (–20.75, y=30.5), (–23.54, y≈33.3), and (–19.09, y≈27.6))
  ∙ All pipe connection attempts between the Offshore Pump and this new Boiler failed due to buildability issues and insufficient pipe resources

────────────────────────
ERROR TIPS
• Movement & Positioning Constraints:
 – Ensure the player’s location is accurately updated before attempting placements; failure to do so (e.g. player reported at (0,0)) can cause distance errors exceeding the maximum allowed.
 – When initial placement fails due to distance constraints, force relocation and allow time for game state updates before reattempting placement.

• Boiler Placement and Buildability:
 – Validate that the target tile is free of obstructions and water overlaps; repeated “can_place_entity returned False” messages indicate the selected candidate positions are not buildable.
 – Pre-check the buildability of the placement area to avoid errors such as overlapping water or invalid surfaces.

• Fluid and Pipe Connection Issues:
 – Confirm that both source and target connection points (e.g. Offshore Pump and Boiler) are accessible and within the allowed proximity for pipe connections.
 – When intermediate candidates are computed for pipe linking, verify that each candidate position is buildable and unobstructed.
 – Monitor inventory levels; errors citing insufficient pipe inventory (e.g. required 16, available 14) suggest the need to stock additional pipes before attempting segmented connections.

• Entity Retrieval and Repositioning:
 – After picking up an entity for repositioning, ensure it is successfully removed from the map before trying to place it again.
 – Validate that the entity is correctly reinserted in a suitable and accessible tile to prevent cascading placement errors.
